intro: Acmella biflora, commonly known as the twin-flowered jewelweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and wetlands. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. Acmella biflora is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in humid climates.
